post_text:
Congratulations to Barrow Foothills Graduate Katie Koonce!

"I will be 17 on the day of our Virtual Graduation, August 27! It is still very shocking to me that I am a high school graduate! I was able to do Dual Enrollment for two semesters at Lanier Tech. During those two semesters, the last one totally digital, I decided that I did not want to go straight to college. I am planning to get a job and experience as many things as I can as a 17 year old heading towards adulthood. I still can't believe I graduated an entire year early! My family and I are grateful that Foothills was an option for me. The "regular" high school situation was not working for me and, obviously, Foothills worked." #thisisfoothills

William Allen, a 2018 graduate of Foothills, began his high school journey in 1965. When he dropped out of high school, Mr. Allen lacked just a few credits to graduate. After enrolling at Madison Foothills, our staff worked to track down Mr. Allen's transcript from 1967, which showed that he needed 3.5 credits to earn a diploma. A little over 50 years after beginning that journey, Mr. Allen celebrated his high school graduation in December 2018 at the age of 71. Congratulations Mr. Allen - we are so proud of you! You are a true testament to the fact that it is never too late to earn your high school diploma. Mr. Allen with Madison Foothills Co-Site Director Quowanna Mattox.

When space is available, our Foothills PLUS program offers students 21 and older the chance to earn a high school diploma at an affordable tuition rate.
